item.role:
Java Project Manager
My assignment was to develop a software the purpose of which was to help the pre-handling (control, archiving, ciphering) of files of the General Inpection division of BNPP, and the upload toward a document management system. As a member of the developers Agile team, I provided all the solutions and I organized the software architecture, thus I was the referent on most of the technical subjects. I also welcomed and trained the new developers and I maintained our test environments.
Environnement
JAVA/JEE (Spring4 MVC, Spring-security SSO, Esapi, nCipher crypto library, JPA2, Hibernate), JQuery, JsTree, Bootstrap Twitter, Oracle DB, Flyway-db, WebSphere, NetBeans, Git, Maven, Sonar, Jira Agile, HP-Quality Center, Jenkins, Automic Ara, Nexus.

Project Management Officer
Aptea is a French IT Outsourcing company specializing in software for business that is particularly sensitive and complex (Energy and Transport). Since I have started with Aptea I have been involved in the guiding and development of fix-price projects.
I was assigned to one customer only (public official establishment) and I carried out a 1800 MD project. The purpose was to refactor wholly a 10 years old software which remained operative yet was based on an outdated set of technologies and also needed to be opened to new stakeholders of the domain. I was a business analyst first, though I also became a technical leader when the project got greater significance. On a second project (started in 03/2014, for another public official establishment) I was fully responsible for the project time and budget, tasks organization and risk management. I led the team and managed all the customer interface.
I guided the business analysis and wrote the SRS.
I designed the architecture and integrated components, (digital signature using Keynectis' solution, Esri cartography API).
I developed whole parts of the software, including the totality of the model layer of the software and the migration scripts.
I managed and trained the software developers.
I managed the customer interface and integrated change requests.
I set the test environment (prepare test machines) for a software validation squad.
Later, I took part during 6 months to an important project of Natixis Assurances as a member of the Design Authority. I was charged to contribute in the technical debt rattrapage.
I also worked 2 months for Safran Morpho and realised a JMS bridge to adapt a product to the technical context of a customer.
Environment: SQL Server, Oracle DB, Postgres, Glassfish, Tomcat, JBoss, JAVA/JEE (JPA2, Hibernate, EJB3, JMS, Spring3 MVC, JSF, Maven), AngularJS, JQuery, Bootstrap Twitter, Lucene, XSL, Digital Signature, SIG, WebDav(Milton), iText, NetBeans, SVN, Mantis, Jenkins, Sonar, Talend, DokuWiki, xWiki, MsProject, Trello, Testlink, UML, BPML, French.

Project Manager
Manages a 6-person team
Project Management, R&D & Solutioning
Needs analysis alongside with customers, Specification & Design
Technologies: Transaction Host: Java, Microsoft SQL Server, Eclipse
Terminal programming: Verifone Vx510, ARM Compiler, Source Insight, C
Miscellaneous: UML, SVN, Testlink, Mantis, Google Apps...
Payment Solutions projects for South-East Asian market:
Pre-paid Top-up Systems for mobile phone suppliers: I achieved several upgrades on the main customer's running system.
Gift Cards, Loyalty Cards and management systems: I promoted and sold the system to prospects, also enhanced functionalities
Electronic Cash Registers: I created a middleware software to interact between the terminal connected via RS232 and any retail management application. I specified the packets sent via serial between the ECR and the terminal, adapted for Softpay. I implemented the exhange of these messages in Java using Javacomm API. Finally I provided a standardized access to this middleware application using CORBA. Then I coached the team in the partner company (evietsoft), helped them to create the CORBA client able to use our middleware application.
iPay: an online payment functionality for Gift Cards System (which I entirely designed)
VIP Service: I created an add-on to iPay to identify members using QR codes and process vip rewards. The QR code scanner uses replycam.com: a flash client for webcams.
PrepaidWebServices: I created a JAX-WS application to let customer accounts download transactions and cards reports in XML format.
Bill Collectors: I specified an add-on for Gift cards system and iPay, the aim of which is to provide the card holders the possibility to pay their bills using our prepaid accounts.
Lines Encryption System between Point-Of-Sales and banking application servers: I introduced the product at the banks headquarters, I installed a pilot version for the biggest state-owned bank in the country)
NFC Payment System & devices: using Proximity Coupling Device, I specified the use cases (flows of transactions) for several projects bound to this technology
Funds Transfer: I partnered a US Corporation to organize Prepaid and Mastercard-based funds transfers between North America and Vietnam using SMS
Integration of various applications on a standalone terminal
As a department lead, I also worked at improving the process (I defined the strategy guidelines, I created workflows for maintenance and new developments and I also brought a quality approach).

Officially agreed end of studies internship :
Contributed to "MdP" team projects, expert in Java/J2E technologies (collaborative working based on Hibernate/Spring/Struts frameworks, Mantis bugtracker, Subversion)
Status and tasks evolved regarding projects:
Knowledge Base Portal:
I supplied solutions (CMS comparisons).
& Installed & Customized & Administrated the CMS EZ-Publish
& Promoted the use of the portal to the team.
I developed complete screens of web applications based on Java framework (Using HQL, JSP, JavaScript, XML, CSS and JEE concepts)
I corrected bugs and executed change-requests on this JEE web application.
Business analyst: I was a relay between IBM VN and IBM FR
I translated documents from French to English, I detailed the specifications, and I filtered out the possible ambiguities.
Internal project:
I had the honour to manage a 1-to-4-person team depending on the iteration (spiral lifecycle). The project was managed following MdP workflow (estimations, planning and tracking). For each iteration I investigated into the needs, searched and proposed my solutions. I contributed greatly in the specification and design of the model, I helped my team in their LAMP or WAMP server or IDE configuration, and I also implemented the most complex parts (using MySQL, PHP, JavaScript/AJAX)
I supplied my ideas about the model design and also technical elements into the context of a new offer
IBM Formations:
Function Points: methods to estimate the charge of projects
Quality Process Awareness and Competency Evaluation: Understanding the concepts of quality assurance
CMMI Awareness: Participation in training sessions with a view to the certification of the development center

Administrated the professionnal database management system "Remedy" for EUROCOPTER at Marignane
+ Created a videoconferencing rooms directory (SQL, PHP)
Officially agreed internship 2006 : Quality Control for java applications, wrote technical documentations and user guides.
